alert.note: Alert for Coconino; Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 18 at 9:02PM MST until July 18 at 10:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR COCONINO AND YAVAPAI COUNTIES... At 900 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated that heavy rain has ended over the warned area, extreme western Coconino and northwestern Yavapai County, east of Peach Springs and along and north of Route 66. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain fell earlier this evening. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Fraziers Well and Hualapai Reservation. This includes the following highways... Route 66 between mile markers 114 and 127. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Albers Wash and Diamond Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
